Name: Grow Smart or Die Fast: 5 Guidelines to Navigate the Recession
Description: Build for the customer journeys of tomorrow and prepare your commerce platform for fast changes in customer and supplier demands. I offer you 5 guiding principles to get ready for the near future and discuss Composable Commerce and (B2B and B2C) marketplaces.

Name: 5 Ultimate usability tips for E-commerce
Description: I’d like to talk about how companies can implement an A/B testing process in their company to start with conversion optimization. This session wil be a combination of theory (models, best practices) and experience from doing this myself.

Name: Let's have a talk about giving talks
Description:
Many people want to go on stage and share their knowledge and experience, but many don't. In this open session I usually 'drag' another regular speaker on stage with me and start talking about how to give talks, how to prepare, the failures I had and mistakes I made. I talk about the impostor symptom and give a lot of practical tips for people who would like to some day present a session at a conference.

No slides are being used during this session.

Name: Building your Optimization Dream Team
Description: In this session I share my experience in building in-house Conversion optimization teams: what platforms, people and processes do you need?
Intended audience: E-commerce manager and/or CRO specialists looking to build/expand their optimization team.

Name: Building your optimization technology stack
Description:
When starting out with a program around optimizing the conversion rate (CRO) or - a bit broader - the customer experience (CXO), you will inevitability run into some challenges around the technology stack you’ll be using.

Let’s talk about that.
Intended audience: E-commerce manager and/or CRO specialists looking to build/expand their optimization software.

Name: Composable Commerce & Packaged Business Capabilities
Description: In today's business landscape, agility and flexibility are key. Organizations are achieving this through a variety of methods, including composable enterprise and PBCs. But what are these two often-heard buzzwords, and how can they help your business?
Intended audience: E-commerce decision makers looking that are interested in exploring modern commerce platform options.

Name: Compute required Sample Size for your A/B tests (A-priori)
Description:
So if you want to get started with A/B testing, you should calculate up front if you have enough users and conversions to see if it is even possible to perform an A/B test on your site. There are some general rules of thumb out there that say "don't go A/B testing when you have < 1000 conversions", which is fine, but probably not really helpful in your situation.

See http://www.gui.do/post/compute-required-sample-size-for-your-ab-tests for the full article and explainer video.

Name: Creating an optimization culture
Description: How to align CRO teams across multiple countries and timezones, all in different stages of digital maturity? During this session, Guido shares his experience and talks about the challenges of building an agile experimentation/ online optimization culture within a large international corporation.

Name: Cross channel possibilities with Magento
Description: Slides I used to present cross channel capabilities with Magento during the ISM eCommerce Cross Channel events.

Name: Cross-cultural website optimization
Description: In this presentation I share my experience with optimizing websites across different countries/cultures. What things are the same, what things are different and what should you do when expanding internationally from a cultural standpoint?
Intended audience: E-commerce managers and team members selling products and/or services in multiple countries.

Name: Crystal ball session: outlook for the coming year
Description: Anninteractive "Commerce Trends/Outlook 2023" session, based on the etailment.de trends article by Alexander Graf.

Name: Data Driven Decisions meets Psychology
Description:
This is a combination of 3 session where Guido will talk about...

1) why psychology is important when you’re selling online
2) how to build an optimization team and
3) talk about optimization culture.

See this blogpost for all background information and additional articles.

Name: Growth strategies for the future of B2B commerce
Description: Build for the customer journeys of tomorrow. To stay ahead of your competitors and keep winning in the next era of digital commerce, B2B companies need to collaborate with suppliers of commerce technology that help then adapt to fast changing marktets. Together with Henk Mensinga from Youwe I discussed how a composable commerce approach helps B2B companies to form a foundation for their futureproof e-commerce strategy.

Name: Improve CRO processes with evolutionary AI
Description: How do you get to the best converting layout of your website? In this case study, Guido talks about how his team is preparing for the next steps in optimizing B2B and B2C e-commerce platforms through Artificial Intelligence systems. Will AI be more efficient and can it replace the regular A/B testing process? This new AI approach is a revolution in the conversion world, with a ground breaking promise all experts are looking out for. Let’s see how it’s being used in practice!

Name: Innovate or get Kodak'ed: 5 Guiding Principles to NOT F#%K up Modern Commerce
Description: Build for the customer journeys of tomorrow and prepare your commerce platform for fast changes in customer and supplier demands. I offer you 5 guiding principles to get ready for the near future and discuss Composable Commerce and (B2B and B2C) marketplaces.

Name: Introduction to Magento
Description: An introduction to Magento's features and it's ecosystem.

Name: Learnings van 9 maanden conversie optimalisatie
Description: Sanoma Breeze sessie over de learnings van 9 maanden conversie optimalisatie bij Kieskeurig.nl

Name: Magento Community versus Enterprise
Description: I created a presentation to explain some similarities and differences between the Magento community and enterprise editions. If you're looking into using Magento but having doubt about the version, I hope this can help to make than decision.

Name: Meet Magento Association
Description: Introduction to the Meet Magento Association, of which I am Vice President for Western Europe.

Name: Persuasive E-commerce
Description:
Presentation or workshop in which I teach the audience about the biases that our brain has, the mistakes we make while making decisions and how we can utilize this in an e-commerce environment.

By far my most popular popular presentation. Started out giving this session in 2011 and it kept evolving over the years in a session I have now given in over 25 countries!
Intended audience: E-commerce teams interested in optimizing and growing their stores by diving into their buyers psychology.

Name: Still A/B testing your buttons? You need to think (much) bigger...
Description:
• CRO/CXO, Experiments and A/B testing have gained a lot of traction in the last years, hopefully also within your company;
  • When optimizing, a lot of commerce teams seem stuck experimenting with minor frontend changes like text, images or layout.
  • While still valuable to do this, you could benefit much more from the experimentation mindset when applying this to not just your frontend, but to across all aspects of your business
  • Guido shows you how using Packaged Business Capabilities can give your commerce team the freedom to do just that.

Name: The Future of Community: Where Psychology, Tech and AI Collide
Description:
As communities continue to evolve, the intersection of psychology and technology is becoming increasingly critical.

I will explore the future trends that are set to redefine how consumers interact with online platforms. From AI-driven personalization to the psychological triggers that drive user engagement, we'll delve into what the future holds and how businesses can prepare for the seismic shifts on the horizon.

By the end of this session, attendees will have

  • a good understanding of latest trends that combine AI and Community building;
  • a list of things they can implement and start experimenting with in their own community right away.

Name: The Future of the Magento Ecosystem
Description: The Magento community is thriving and wants to push forward fast. This presentation is about feelings and ideas that live within the community and that I've discussed with many at Meet Magento conferences and on IM chats in the past months. I presented this at the Magento Snowcamp in Austria in January and this week at Meet Magento in Spain. Let me know what you think in the comments!

Name: Usability Testing
Description: Slides from my 5 minute pitch at startup accelerator Rockstart in April 2015

Name: Why becoming a Marketplace should be your Next Big Initiative
Description:
Together with Marnix from SQLI I hosted a session about marketplaces for retail organizations. What are all marketplace variants? What is the difference between selling on a marketplace and becoming a marketplace? What are the latest developments and why do we think you really need to be the first mover in your industry when it comes to marketplaces...

More info about Sprykers Enterprise Marketplace Capabilities.

‍

Name: Why Marketplace is Your Next Big Initiative
Description: Togetehr with Marnix Dekker from our partner SQLI I disucss why starting a marketplace can be a huge multiplier for your business, and why you need to start with that TODAY.

Name: Your path to becoming a (more) Customer Centric Business
Description: In this presentation and workshop I discuss recent industry reports, share fresh CRO research and guide you through the setup of the optimization process and how to grow it based on your current company and team maturity levels. We discuss the optimal workflow, how to increase team knowledge, how to improve management buy-in and how to prioritize. We discuss how to improve your experimentation velocity, capacity and coverage, and how to set your KPIs. We do a workshop on hypothesis setting and will show you how you can estimate long-term ROI.
